source.description: A Schema validated xml file, that contains values for some of the order by tests generated by NIST.
An uvalidated xml file, that contains values for some of the order by tests generated by NIST.

test-case.name: orderBy1
test-case.description: Evaluation of "order by" clause with the "order by" clause of a FLWR expression set to "$x ", where $x is a set of Strings and the ordering mode set to ascending
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"; <results> { for $x in /DataValues/Strings/orderData order by $x ascending return $x } </results>

result.assert-xml: <results xmlns="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"><orderData>A String</orderData><orderData>B String</orderData><orderData>C String</orderData><orderData>D String</orderData><orderData>E String</orderData><orderData>F String</orderData><orderData>G String</orderData><orderData>H String</orderData><orderData>I String</orderData><orderData>J String</orderData><orderData>K String</orderData><orderData>L String</orderData><orderData>M String</orderData><orderData>N String</orderData><orderData>O String</orderData><orderData>P String</orderData><orderData>R String</orderData><orderData>S String</orderData><orderData>T String</orderData><orderData>U String</orderData><orderData>V String</orderData><orderData>W String</orderData><orderData>X String</orderData><orderData>Y String</orderData><orderData>Z String</orderData></results>

test-case.name: orderBy66
test-case.description: Multiple order by clauses. Permitted in 3.0
test-case.test:
declare default element namespace "http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy";
for $i in 1 to 100 order by -$i count $count let $e := <e i="{$i}" pos="{$count}"/> order by number($e/@i) where $count gt 90 return $e!@pos!number()

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-33
test-case.description: Uncomparable values in order by, but without for clause(stable sort).
test-case.test: let $i := (xs:hexBinary("FF"), xs:hexBinary("FF")) stable order by $i[1] return $i

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-34
test-case.description: Uncomparable values in order by, but without for clause(stable sort).
test-case.test: let $i := (xs:hexBinary("FF"), xs:hexBinary("FF")) order by $i[1] return $i

test-case.test: let $i := (xs:hexBinary("FF"), xs:time("03:03:03Z"), xs:hexBinary("FF")) stable order by $i[1] return $i

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-37
test-case.description: Unused order by.
test-case.test: for $i in (1, 3, 2) stable order by () return $i

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-38
test-case.description: 'order by' combined with reverse().
test-case.test: for $i in (1, 2, 3) stable order by 1 return reverse(($i, "FO"))

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-39
test-case.description: Contains a type error, but the result can be computed without evaluation.
test-case.test: for $a in (1, 4, 2) let $i := (1, 3, 2) order by $i return 1

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-40
test-case.description: Updated by Benjamin Nguyen on 2010-10-18T:13:07:50+02:00 to resolve bug 10651 Overshadowing variable that leads to type error.

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-41
test-case.description: order by, with many let bindings inbetween.

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-42
test-case.description: Apply fn:string() on a for clause that only produces on item, and that cannot easily constant propagate.
test-case.test: string(for $i in current-date() order by $i return $i)

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-43
test-case.description: Extract the effective boolean value from the result of order by.
test-case.test: if(for $i in <e> <a id="3"/> <b id="2"/> <c id="1"/> </e>/* order by xs:integer($i/@id) return $i) then 4 else 9

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-44
test-case.description: Sort, with a where and let clause in between.
test-case.test: for $a in (2, 1) let $b := 1 where true() order by $a return $a

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-45
test-case.description: Short key-for involved in sorting.
test-case.test: for $a in (3, 2, 1), $b in (6) stable order by $b return $a

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-46
test-case.description: Sort special floating point values.
test-case.test: let $numbers := (1, 2, 1.3, 3e3, xs:double("NaN"), xs:double("-INF"), xs:double("INF")) return (for $i in $numbers order by $i empty least return $i, "SEP", for $i in $numbers order by $i empty greatest return $i)

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-47
test-case.description: Sort special floating point values(stable sort).
test-case.test: let $numbers := (1, 2, 1.3, 3e3, xs:double("NaN"), xs:double("-INF"), xs:double("INF")) return (for $i in $numbers stable order by $i empty least return $i, "SEP", for $i in $numbers order by $i empty greatest return $i)

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-48
test-case.description: Sort special floating point values.
test-case.test: let $numbers := (<e>NaN</e>, <e/>, <e/>, <e>NaN</e>, <e>NaN</e>, <e>INF</e>, <e>NaN</e>, <e/>, <e>3</e>, comment{"3"}) return (for $i in $numbers order by xs:double($i/text()) empty least return xs:double($i/text()), "SEP", for $i in $numbers order by xs:double($i/text()) empty greatest return xs:double($i/text()))

result.assert-string-value: NaN NaN NaN NaN 3 INF SEP 3 INF NaN NaN NaN NaN

test-case.name: K2-OrderbyExprWithout-49
test-case.description: Sort special floating point values(stable sort).
test-case.test: let $numbers := (<e>NaN</e>, <e/>, <e/>, <e>NaN</e>, <e>NaN</e>, <e>INF</e>, <e>NaN</e>, <e/>, <e>3</e>, comment{"3"}) return (for $i in $numbers stable order by xs:double($i/text()) empty least return xs:double($i/text()), "SEP", for $i in $numbers stable order by xs:double($i/text()) empty greatest return xs:double($i/text()))

result.assert-string-value: NaN NaN NaN NaN 3 INF SEP 3 INF NaN NaN NaN NaN
